turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I need some fashion advice, but I'm on a *very* tight budget. Like, think 'surviving college' budget. I need a new outfit for a friend's birthday party. Can you help?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I can definitely help with that! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me your budget limit, the general style you're aiming for (e.g., casual, semi-formal, trendy), and your size? Also, what's the venue like (e.g., restaurant, club, house party)?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, all the questions! Okay, okay. Budget is like... $50 max. I'm a women's size medium, and I guess semi-formal-ish? It's at a brewery. I'm just so tired of wearing the same jeans and t-shirt everywhere!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright, $50 for a semi-formal brewery outfit. I recommend checking out stores like H&M, Forever 21, or Shein for affordable options. You could try pairing a simple, solid-colored midi skirt (around $15-20) with a dressy tank top or blouse (around $15-20). Add some simple jewelry and shoes you already own, or look for clearance shoes for under $15. Alternatively, consider a jumpsuit. Some outlets like ThredUp may provide even lower prices on pre-owned clothes. Does this sound like a reasonable direction?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's... actually pretty good. I hadn't thought about a midi skirt. But how can I make it look like I *didn't* spend only $50? Like, any tips on making cheap clothes look more expensive? Is that even possible?!
